intro: Schmaltzia trilobata var. anisophylla, commonly known as the variable three-lobed schmaltzia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with three distinct lobes, and its small, white flowers are arranged in umbels. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. The varietal name "anisophylla" refers to its variable leaf structure, which can differ in shape and size depending on environmental conditions.
